phenotype.explanation of phenotyping 1: We call phenotype the set of observable symptoms that an individual presents as a result of the interaction between their genotype (set of genetic characteristics) and the environment that surrounds them. The process of studying these characteristics is known as phenotyping.
phenotype.explanation of phenotyping 2: The phenotype of an individual includes its morphology, its development, its biochemical characteristics, its physiology and its behavior. All of them are aspects that are very important to reach the diagnosis of a disease.
phenotype.explanation to add phenotype: You can complete the phenotype in several ways:

Under strict conditions, products in development can be made available to groups of patients who have a disease with no satisfactory authorised therapies and who cannot enter clinical trials.

diagnosis.DashboardTitle: Raito is for research use only. It does not diagnose, it produces a ranked list of suspected genes which provide assistance for rare disease cases. Patients should discuss their findings with their healthcare provider. Our clinical results use a set of scoring algorithms which compare semantic similarity of each of your clinical findings to those that are normally exhibited by each disease. High similarity results in a high score for a disease.

geneticsection.title: Genetic information
geneticsection.subtitle1: If you have genetic information on the patient you can upload it here. We need the data in VCF format
geneticsection.subtitle2: What is this file and how to get it?
geneticsection.nogenetic: The patient doesn’t have genetic information. This is fine, you can continue to the next step.
geneticsection.pantelInfoVcfSubtitle: We explain here the importance of the VCF files and how to get them.
geneticsection.panelInfoVcfp1: In order to identify the cause of many rare diseases, the best strategy is to search for genetic characteristics that can be linked to the patient set of symptoms. These characteristics are known as variants. There are many variants, so they are usually put together in one or more Variant Call Format (VCF) files as candidate variants.
geneticsection.panelInfoVcfp2: It is usual that these files are never sent to the patient or the physicians by the labs, but in many cases, it is vital to reanalyze them as the patient symptoms progress. The patient has the right to have a copy of these files, so the easiest way to get them is for the patient to request a copy. Ask the patient to get in touch with us at support@foundation29.org and we will send a short tutorial on how to do it.
geneticsection.nogeneticinfo: There is no genetic information, do you want to continue?

adminGTP.GTP Error: Special cases of applications and status

Our name comes from an exceptional day, February 29th, International Day of rare diseases.
We create expert systems that capture data in a transparent and automatic way, so that the analysis allows patients, industry and institutions to improve their capacity in the decision-making related to health
security.We want to give citizens control over th: We want to give citizens control over their data to support biomedical research
We empower people to make decisions about their own health, based on evidence provided by data, supported by artificial intelligence systems.
security.Our objective is to empower the patients: Our objective is to empower the patients. DDPis the tool we have created to give citizens control over their data.
DDP is a health data platform that gathers medical data frompatients, clinicians, devices and other data sources.
security.It has been created by a multidisciplina: It has been created by a multidisciplinary group of professionals –Duchenne Parent Project Netherlands patient organization, engineering, medicine,artificial intelligence –withyears of experience in the application of technologyto the field of health
security.DDP–Data access, privacy and security co: DDP–Data access, privacy and security considerations
DDP has been designed to meet European and US regulations on data security by using a  cloud  storage  that  guarantees  such  security.  The  platform  is  based  on Azure,  a commercial product  from  Microsoftthat  provides  cloud  computation  and  storage capabilities.
Azure has established a set of standards for ensuring privacy and security, storing and backing up data, and securely deleting data upon request from the customer. Azure meets  a  broad  set  of  international  and  industry-specific  compliance  standards  and regulations applicable to cloud service providers, such as ISO 27001, HIPAA, FedRAMP, SOC 1 and SOC 2, as well as country-specific standards including Australia IRAP, UK G-Cloud, and Singapore MTCS. Microsoft offers EU Standard Contractual Clauses that provide contractual guarantees around transfers of personal data and has approval from the EU’s Article 29 Working Party for contractual commitments.
security.For more information about Microsoft Azu: For more information about Microsoft Azure security:
security.DDP has been designed to comply with new: DDP has been designed to comply with new european GDPR requirements.
security.Access to DDP is controlled through logi: Access to DDP is controlled through login with user ID and password as discussed in an access specific section below.
security.DDP ensures quality in data input by sta: DDP ensures quality in data input by standardized and consistent procedures for data entry:
security.Setting up validation rules or input mas: Setting up validation rules or input masks in data entry software
Using data entry screens or bot assistant* Using controlled vocabularies, code lists and choicelists to minimize manual data entry
security.Detailed labelling of variable and recor: Detailed labelling of variable and record names to avoid confusion
security.Designing a purpose-built database struc: Designing a purpose-built database structure to organize data and data files
security.Accompanying notes and contextual help a: Accompanying notes and contextual help about the data
DDP also provides the required audit trail for reconstruction of the history of any addition, deletion or alteration in the recorded data that will support external audits
security.DDP data governance principles are as fo: DDP data governance principles are as follows:
All data and material sharing agreements should be ethically robust and mindful of the responsibilities owed to the donors to make best ethical use of the samples and data consistent with their consent.
Data will be owned by patient. Patient organization might play de role of guardian for these data when designated by the patient or caregiver.
When used outside the context of a clinician-patient relationship, patient will give the explicit consent to share the data in anonymous way with third parties.
In these cases, patient anonymity will be preserved. If obtained data that is to be published in reports, scientific meetings or specialized publications, data will be shown in de-identified and aggregated formats, that is, numeric, graphic or percentages data, without any possible patient identification, and never shown as individual records.
When used in the context of a clinician-patient relationship, such as for management of  the  patient  disease  by  their  clinician  or  during  a  drug  trial,  patient  data  will  be accessible by the designated clinician in an identifiable way. When a clinician-owned database is required, DDP will act as a source data capture tool and transfer a copy of the data to the clinician/hospital-managed database.
Access  to DDP  is  controlled  through  login  with  user  ID  and  password.  We  have implemented an access control based in roles. Super administrator, Administrator, and Patientare the main ones. Each of them will have different read/write access to data, being the administrator the only user to grant access to other users to his/her account.
To maintain anonymity, a particular patient's data queries are not directly made overthe ID stored in the database, but on the encrypted ID. In addition, two databases have been created to separate the accounts and personal identification data form patients from the rest of the clinical data.
Informed consent is the process by which it is guaranteed that the subject has voluntarily expressed  their  intention  to  participate  in  the  investigation,  having  understood  the information that has been given, about the study objectives, benefits, discomfort, the possible risks and alternatives, their rights and responsibilities.
Every new DDP user has to agree to the general Informed Consent and Privacy Policy before proceeding with the application. When agreeing to participate in specific research projects or trials subjects might be requested to sign additional project-specific Inform Consents.

policy.Identification and contact details of Da: Identification and contact details of Data Controller.
policy.Duchenne Parent Project Netherlands, a n: Duchenne Parent Project Netherlands, a non profit entity with registered office at Landjuweel 16-8, 3905 PG, Veenendaal (The Netherlands) (hereinafter, 'Duchenne Parent Project NL') is the data controller (hereinafter, the 'Data Controller') for the processing of personal data of Duchenne Data Platform’s users (hereinafter, 'DDP').
policy.Fundación 29 de Febrero, a non-profit en: 'Fundación 29 de Febrero', a non-profit entity with registered office at Santa Fe 1, 2 E, 28224, Pozuelo de Alarcón, Madrid (Spain) (hereinafter, 'Foundation' or 'Fundation 29'), is the Data Processor, for the processing of DDP data on behalf of the controller.
DDP is an online platform created by Duchenne Parent Project NL in cooperation with Foundation 29, in order to facilitate research and help with the treatment of and better care for patients with Duchenne. To this end, we have created a database of Duchenne patients, inextricably connected to the use of DDP.
Should you have any query regarding the processing of your personal data, do not hesitate to contact us through mail to the above-indicated address or by e-mail to info@duchenne.nl.
All fields of the registration form are mandatory. Omission of any of these fields shall entail the inability to register successfully to DDP. You must provide with true information. The use of alias or means to occult your identity is forbidden, unless the registration process explicitly demands the creation of a user name, nick or alias.
policy.It is important that you keep your acces: It is important that you keep your access details secret. You shall be solely liable for the use of your personal account and thus you commit to use your information with due diligence, not to share it with third parties and communicate any loss or theft.
policy.In order to keep your information up to: In order to keep your information up to date, you shall communicate any modification and/or rectification as soon as possible by email to info@duchenne.nl. You can also update your personal data through the corresponding settings of your account.
policy.We hereby inform you that you may exerci: We hereby inform you that you may exercise the following rights:
policy.Right to access your personal data in or: Right to access your personal data in order to know how and to what purpose it is being processed;
policy.Right to rectification of any inaccurate: Right to rectification of any inaccurate data;
policy.Right to erasure of personal data, where: Right to erasure of personal data, where it is possible;
Right to demand the limitation to the processing of data where accuracy, lawfulness or necessity of the processing activity is in question. In this case we may keep personal data blocked for exercising or defending claims;
Right to object the processing, where the legal basis for the processing is a legitimate interest of the Foundation. In this case, the Foundation shall stop processing your data unless it is entitled with an overriding legitimate interest or data is necessary for the exercise or defense of claims;
Right to data portability from Foundation to another data controller, where the legal basis for the processing of this data is consent or performance of a contract;
policy.Right to revoke, at any time, the consen: Right to revoke, at any time, the consent granted.
You may exercise your rights at any moment and free of charge by means of an e-mail to info@duchenne.nl or mail to the Duchenne Parent Project NL registered offices’ address, indicating the right you wish to exercise and enclosing a copy of a document certifying your identity.
You can also file a claim before the Dutch Data Protection Authority if you believe an infringement regarding the processing of your personal data has been committed.
Registration and use of the platform.
Performance of the service requested to the Data Controller, even if this service is free of charge.
We will not share your personal data with third parties. Any personal information you wish to share must be shared by you directly. We will make that process easy for you.
One of our main service providers, Microsoft Azure, is established in a third country outside the territory of the European Union. We have put in place appropriate safeguards in order to guarantee that your personal data enjoys an equivalent protection to that it would have under EU regulations. If you want to receive more information with regard to these appropriate safeguards, you can contact us by writing to
policy.For more information about Microsoft Azu: For more information about Microsoft Azure security:
During the performance of the service, until you unsubscribe from the platform. We may retain your personal data, duly blocked, for the statute of limitation of liabilities arising from the processing or during the period established in applicable regulations.
policy.Storage and management of health-related: Storage and management of health-related data.
We will not share your personal data with any third party without your prior express and specific consent. All information we may share with caregivers, doctors, researchers or other third parties will always be anonymized or aggregated data, i.e. data that cannot be related to an identified individual.
However, we have certain service providers who may need to access your data in order to perform adequately the services hired. These service providers belong to sectors related to information systems and administrative services.
policy.During the performance of the service, u: During the performance of the service, until you unsubscribe from the platform.
We may retain your personal data, duly blocked, for the statute of limitation of liabilities arising from the processing or for the period established in applicable regulations.
once you unsubscribe from the platform, you will be given the choice to donate your data (subject to prior anonymization) for statistical and research purposes
We will anonymise your personal data; therefore, we will not retain any of your personal information from you can be identified
We will keep confidential and secret any personal data we may gather through DDP, in accordance with the applicable legislation. We have implemented security measures with regard to personal data in compliance with applicable legislation, in order to prevent the risks of accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to your personal data. For the implementation of the aforementioned measures, we have taken into account the state of the art, the nature of data and the potential risks to which the processing is exposed.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, and despite the Data Controller carries out its best efforts to keep personal data of users secure, Internet communications are not completely safe and therefore the Data Controller is not in a position to guarantee the infallible security of data in its transit to DDP. Accordingly, you acknowledge providing your personal information to the Data Controller at your own risk until we have received it.
Below you may find more information regarding our commitment with security and confidentiality of your information.
Users under 16 years old are not allowed to use DDP without the prior authorization of their parents, tutors or legal representatives, who shall be solely responsible for any activity carried out through DDP by minors under their responsibility, including the registration in DDP.
In line with the abovementioned, and since the Data Controller have not the capacity to control whether the users are or are not under age, their parents shall be the ones to implement the necessary mechanisms in order to prevent minors to access DDP and/or facilitate personal data without their supervision. The Data Controller bears no responsibility in this regard.
The Data Controller may update this Privacy Policy. Therefore, it is important for you to revise it periodically. Where possible, you should revise this policy every time you access DDP, in order to be adequately informed about the information collected and the processing thereof.
You may find this Privacy Policy in the footer of the webpage of DDP. Notwithstanding this, we will inform you about any change to this Privacy Policy affecting to the processing of your personal data.
policy.DPP might come back to you in order to a: DPP might come back to you in order to ask for specific consent under the framework of a specific project

dataprocessing.title: DATA PROCESSING AGREEMENT - Raito
dataprocessing.p1-1: The service provided by Fundación 29 de Febrero through the tool Raito is focused on helping clinicians and genetists during the process of diagnosing rare diseases, reducing time and making it more precise. Using artificial intelligence algorithms, it helps specialists to incorporate patient information to identify symptoms and find connections between them, guiding them in the identification of new symptoms. Finally, Raito suggests a classified list of pathologies for the professional to consider carrying out new tests and thus confirm the final diagnosis. The algorithms used during this process are improved periodically with the data provided by the specialists.
dataprocessing.p1-2: The users are professional specialists, related to medicine and genetics (hereinafter, 'the user' / 'the users'), who want to use the service provided by Raito. As such, they are CONTROLLER of their patient's data.
dataprocessing.p1-3: In this way Fundación 29 will be the PROCESSOR of the data to provide the service with the purpose expressed in the first paragraph.
dataprocessing.p1-4: For the provision of such service it is necessary that the PROCESSOR have access and perform patient’s personal data processing.
dataprocessing.p1-5: Both parties, CONTROLLER and PROCESSOR, acknowledge complying with all the obligations derived from the community and national regulations in matters of data protection, especially those related to the right of information, consent and duty of secrecy, and the adoption of security measures technical and organizational measures that guarantee the security of personal data.
dataprocessing.p1-6: By means of the present text the PROCESSOR is enabled to deal on behalf of the CONTROLLER with the patient’s personal data necessary to provide the service described above.
dataprocessing.p1-7: For the execution of the provision of services derived from the fulfillment of this assignment, the CONTROLLER makes available to the PROCESSOR the information described below:
dataprocessing.p2-2: Use personal data subject to treatment or those collected for the purpose of this assignment.
dataprocessing.p2-3: Not communicate the data to third parties, unless under the express authorization of CONTROLLER, in the legally admissible cases.
dataprocessing.p2-4: The PROCESSOR must observe at all times, and in relation to the files of personal data to which he had access or could be delivered by the CONTROLLER, for the realization in each case of the work and services that may be agreed, the duty of confidentiality and professional secrecy that, in accordance with the provisions of the European Data Protection regulations, will survive even after finalizing the list of works commissioned in relation to any file and, where appropriate, after completion for any reason of this contract.
dataprocessing.p2-5: The PROCESSOR will notify the CONTROLLER, without undue delay, and in any case before the maximum period of 72 hours, and through email, the breaches of the security of the personal data in its charge of which it has knowledge, together with all the relevant information for the documentation and communication of the incident. Notification will not be necessary when it is unlikely that such a breach of security constitutes a risk to the rights and freedoms of the persons whose data is collected on the platform.
dataprocessing.p2-6: Implement the necessary security measures to:
dataprocessing.p2-6-1: Guarantee the confidentiality, integrity, availability and permanent resilience of the treatment systems and services.
dataprocessing.p2-6-2: Restore availability and access to personal data as quickly as possible according to the situation, in case of physical or technical incident.
dataprocessing.p2-6-3: To verify, evaluate and assess, on a regular basis, the effectiveness of the technical and organizational measures implemented to guarantee the safety of the treatment.
dataprocessing.p2-7-1: The PROCESSOR undertakes to destroy the data once the service has been completed. Once destroyed, the PROCESSOR must certify its destruction in writing and must provide verification to the CONTROLLER. However, the PROCESSOR can keep a copy, with the data duly recorded, as long as responsibilities for the execution of the service can be derived.
dataprocessing.p3-1: Carry out an evaluation of the impact on the protection of personal data of the treatment operations to be carried out by the person in charge.
dataprocessing.p3-2: Carry out the corresponding prior consultations
dataprocessing.p3-3: Ensure, prior to and throughout the treatment, compliance with the Regulation (GDPR in EU)
dataprocessing.p3-4: To resolve with their patients, in relation to the data object of the service, the exercise of the rights of:
dataprocessing.p4-1: The CONTROLLER, in its condition, reserves the right to carry out at any time the controls and audits it deems appropriate to verify the correct compliance by the PROCESSOR of this agreement. From its part, the PROCESSOR shall provide CONTROLLER with as many data or documents as it may require for the proper compliance of said controls and audits.
dataprocessing.p4-2: Any notification that is made between the parties will be made in writing and will be delivered personally or in any other way that certifies the reception by the notified party.
dataprocessing.p4-3: The present writing and the relations between the CONTROLLER and the PROCESSOR do not constitute in any case society, joint venture, agency or work contract between the parties.

homepatientdx.title: When you donate blood, you can save a life
homepatientdx.subtitle: When you donate your medical data, you can save many lives
homepatientdx.titlep1.1: Register as a patient for Raito and donate your medical data.
homepatientdx.titlep1.2: With the information of all donors we want to progress in the knowledge of rare diseases so that other patients can finally have a diagnosis
homepatientdx.titlep2.1.1: Every time you visit a doctor or get tested, you generate health data.
homepatientdx.titlep2.1.2: You are the sole owner of that data and decide how it should be used.
homepatientdx.titlep2.1.3: You can choose to donate this information to improve the lives of people already diagnosed and those still in the process
homepatientdx.titlep2.2: Your data will enrich the knowledge about rare diseases and facilitate the diagnosis of other people.
homepatientdx.titlep3.1: Your data are yours and will continue to be
homepatientdx.subtitlep3.1: All your medical information is your property. You can remove it at any time.
homepatientdx.titlep3.2: Your data will be private and secure
homepatientdx.subtitlep3.2: Your data will always be protected. You'll decide who to share it with.
homepatientdx.titlep3.3: Your data will support research projects
homepatientdx.subtitlep3.3: We will not transfer your data or market with third parties. Its sole purpose is research to improve diagnosis.
homepatientdx.subtitlep4.1: Sign up as a patient on Raito
homepatientdx.subtitlep4.2: and follow a simple process to share your medical data (diagnosis, reports, symptoms...). You'll be able to complete it even if you don't have a diagnosis yet.
homepatientdx.subtitlep4.3: At the end of the process you will get a downloadable report summarizing your condition and a graphical representation of your position in the complex universe of rare diseases as well as your digital data donor card.
homepatientdx.titlep5.1: Spread the word and recommend others donate their data. Share this link:
homepatientdx.titlep5.2: Share this image on your social networks.
homepatientdx.titlep5.3: Ask your doctor to register as a professional.

dashboardpatient.msgIntro: Raito is a tool to change the way we do medicine. With Raito you can indicate the symptoms you have as a patient. This information is important so that we can use it to diagnose other patients as the information we have in current databases is not correct. Your data are yours, we will only use them to improve the diagnostic engines, always with anonymous information. In exchange, we will try to give you features that will help you on a daily basis, such as a map that indicates where you are compared to other patients like you or a report that helps you explain your condition. But the most important thing is that with your help you will be able to help others like you. Can you help us?
dashboardpatient.Calculating your position on the map: Calculating your position on the map
dashboardpatient.textmap1: This map shows your position (red big dot) with respect to other patients with similar conditions. Each dot in the map is an individual patient, with each color representing a disease. The color scale is limited, meaning that a given color may be used more than once. Diseases in the map should be identified primarly by position, being the color an additional helper. The dispersion of each disease is due to the variability of its symptoms. Some diseases may overlap if they are very similar.
dashboardpatient.textmap2: It is important to note that distances between patients of the same disease (close together) can be used to draw conclusions about the differences between them, but this can not be done between points far appart. In other words: when comparing two patients close to you to yourself, if one point is a little further away from you than the other one it means it is a little more different from you than the other one, but if both points are vey far away, it is not possible to compare them using the same reasoning applied to close cases.
dashboardpatient.subtitleSearchCondition: To start this journey, we simply need you to search for your disease in the space and select it from the drop-down

InfoDx29.title: The accuracy of Raito
InfoDx29.p1: Our disease calculation algorithm analyzes and processes the symptoms you provide and, based on this information, proposes a list of possible diagnoses.
InfoDx29.p3: To gain your trust, we have tested it by generating different scenarios. There is not enough public and anonymous patient data, so we have performed simulations as follows:
InfoDx29.p5:
We created a list of patients. For a list of about 10000 diseases, based on the symptom information provided by both Orphanet and OMIM of the diseases, we have two types of patients:
  • The ideal ones, whose symptoms are formed only by a selection of the known symptoms of a disease.
  • Realistic patients., whose symptoms, unlike the previous ones, will contain not so precise symptoms. This is best understood by the example of focal onset epileptic seizures. In some patients, instead of including this symptom, we have included epileptic seizures, a term that is less precise than the previous one according to HPO.
InfoDx29.p8: We have run our condition calculation algorithm with phenotyping of all the above. With this, we obtained an ordered list of candidate diagnoses. The ranking criterion or score of this result is given by Monarch.
InfoDx29.p9: The results of these tests are shown below. As you can see, our algorithm depends very strongly on the quality of the symptoms you provide. Thus, the more accurate you are with the input symptoms, the better results we will be able to give you.
InfoDx29.p11: With ideal patients we predict the correct disease in the top 10 in 91.9 % (top-10) of the patients.
InfoDx29.p12: On the other hand, with the realistic patients the hit percentage in the top 10 is 51.1%.
InfoDx29.p13: If you have any questions about how Raito works or how we can help you, please contact us.
InfoDx29.Percentage of success of the disease: Percentage of success of the disease

land.Drag and drop file here: Drag and drop a file here
land.descripReports: We understand that these data are very sensitive. If you do not register, all the data will be deleted when you close this window.

table.d1: Automatically find your symptoms in your medical reports in virtually any language and organize your history.
table.t2: Seize your little time with physicians
table.d2: Arrange your own data chronologically to tell your medical history fast and center on what is important.
table.d3: Share your case with your physician. If you are a Physician you can manage multiple cases from your patients panel.
table.d4: Use state-of-the-art algorithms to predict what rare disease fits your data. Add genetic information, if available, for more accurate results.
table.d5: List of validated symptoms and candidate diseases
table.d6: Differential Diagnosis, disease description and more
table.d8: Manage more than one case if you are a Physician
table.d10: Advanced genetic trio analysis functionality included
table.d11: Sharing capabilities with doctors and professionals
table.d12: Improve your diagnosis with new data
table.d13: Create and edit your symptom timeline
table.d14: Easy to read and share with your doctor

aboutUs.title: What is Raito?
aboutUs.p2: If you already have a diagnosis, you will be able to generate your medical history and also keep up to date with clinical trials and patient groups of your disease.
aboutUs.p1: Raito is a non-profit project to help patients and physicians understand the patient disease. It is a completely free software for analysis and management of your symptoms, creation and sharing of your medical history and help to reach a diagnosis.
aboutUs.p3: The data in Raito can only be shared by its owner. Foundation 29 will never share it with anyone. In the future, we will include functionality so that patients can store their own data in their own private data space. If you want to be updated on the progress of this and other projects, sign up here:
aboutUs.p1f29: We are a non-profit foundation. We work for a medicine in which empowered patients take control of their health through their data and work with doctors and institutions to improve their well-being and that of others.
aboutUs.p2f29: We create technologies that allow a radical change in your capabilities as users and in the entire medical ecosystem.
aboutUs.p3f29: The activism of patients, their families and associations are at our core. We put special focus on rare diseases. They are in our origin and in our name: February 29, world day of rare diseases.

general.title: More information
general.msgSend: Welcome to the rebellion, you will know about us
general.Rev-p1: Your disease symptoms are wrong! Join the revolution!

timeline.title: We are going to help you build a timeline of your symptoms. This data can improve your disease management and help other patients like you on their diagnostic odyssey. There are 2 easy steps:
timeline.subtitlea: This report shows the data included in Raito with the aim of improving patient-physician communication. It is recommended to
timeline.subtitleb: take the report to the next medical visit so that both the patient and the physician can help to further refine the contents.
timeline.footer1: We are a non-profit organisation that designs and creates tools for patients to manage their own data, revolutionising the
timeline.footer2: diagnosis and management of rare diseases. We empower patients and doctors to use their medical data or their benefit and that
timeline.footer3: of the community. We believe there is a better way to do things centred on the patient and their data.
timeline.footer6: For any questions or queries, please contact us at
timeline.titlet0: Organize your symptoms in a chronology
timeline.t0: This is very important to have a clear vision of your case. If you can't remember the day a symptom started, add an approximate date.
timeline.t0-p1: This data can improve your disease management and also the disease databases to help other patients like you on their diagnostic odyssey.
timeline.t0-p2: Don't lose your progress. Remember that you can download this data to share it with your doctor or colleagues.
timeline.t0-app: Don't miss the opportunity to create your chronological symptom report!
timeline.t2: Take as much time as you need to add the information for each symptom and you will automatically be able to see how they are organised in the timeline.
timeline.displayed here: The timeline will be displayed here
timeline.errorDates: The end date cannot be earlier than the start date.
timeline.selectEndOrCurrent: You must select end date for this symptom or check if you still have it
timeline.ExitDiscard: Any changes you have made will be discarded.
timeline.WaitDownload: Please wait, your timeline data is being downloaded.
timeline.p1: If you want to save your timeline so you can edit it, download it and/or share it with your doctor at any time, please register in Raito.
timeline.p2: We have taken the trouble to prepare you for your new role, so <ins>you will have all the data you have entered in your new profile</ins> to make your take-off as comfortable as possible.
timeline.p3: In addition to this, Raito will give you a number of new powers, including:

timeline.HelpDates: If you do not know the exact onset or ending day of a symptom, give for example the first day of the month.
timeline.errorExportPDF: There are errors in your timeline data, please check it and try again.

symptoms.t1: Current symptom databases are not accurate. <ins>The world needs your help</ins> so that your disease is well described and we can help others who are looking for a diagnosis.
symptoms.t2: Select the most important symptoms of your disease, a maximum of 10.

DonorData.question: What do you want?
DonorData.op1: I want to know more about my disease
DonorData.free: If you want other things, write them here
DonorData.msgform: Thank you for joining the patient revolution!
DonorData.title: Thank you
DonorData.p1: The data you can give us about your disease by completing the different steps of the timeline, is very important. Because that information does not come directly from patients, but from traditional databases - which are used to make diagnoses and contains inaccurate information about rare diseases -.
DonorData.p2: At Fundación 29 we want to change the way medicine is done. We want patient data to be used and for more research to be done with it.
DonorData.p3: We are building a tool to speed up the diagnosis of rare diseases (Raito) and we need your data to make it more accurate so we can help more and more patients.
DonorData.p4: Join our revolution by donating these data and leaving your email address here. We will also keep you informed of our progress.

preland.t1: Do you have a rare disease? Start telling your story
preland.t2: Every patient has a story that needs to be heard. We help you to tell yours, and get a personalized report with all your symptoms. This is the beginning of the rare disease revolution.
preland.t3: We apply artificial intelligence to help deduce accurate diagnoses from the patient symptoms and from their genetic information, if available.
preland.t4: Try the functionality here and register to harness its full potential.
preland.p1: First, let us know who you are:
preland.p2.2: I want to know more about my disease
preland.This site would not be possible: This site would not be possible without the resources developed by

prom.subtitle: These are questionnaires from your Patient Organization to gather your opinion.
prom.You have datapoints to complete: You have community questions to answer
prom.You have completed: You have completed today's community questions. Thanks!
prom.q1: Is the number of seizures the most relevant problem for you?
prom.q2: Does your child have problems walking or with movement?
prom.a2.2: S/he does it with a lot of difficulty
prom.q3: How does your child’s appetite change due to their treatment?
prom.a3.1: S/he does not want to eat
prom.a3.5: S/he does much more than usual
prom.q4: Can your child understand verbal instructions?
prom.a4.2: S/he does it with a lot of difficulty
prom.q5: Does your child always experience seizures in the same way or do they vary?
prom.q6: Is there anything you think triggers your child’s seizures?
prom.q7: Are you or your child able to predict when they will have a seizure?
prom.q8: If a drug company were to develop a new treatment for Dravet syndrome what would you like to see in terms of improvement for your child?

landraito.t1: You have the power to boost medicine
landraito.p1: Patient data are critical for research. Help to develop new treatments and improve research without leaving home. Raito is your personal health data container
landraito.t2.1a: Create your account to get on board of your data container. We will help you to easily create it to store your data on your own devices.
landraito.t2.2a: We will help you to include and keep up to date your patient data easily. Your data is what fuels evidence-based medicine and research.
landraito.t2.3a: Join a patient community to contribute your data anonymously and boost your reach with institutions and applications that will help you and other patients.
landraito.t3.1: Available on your mobile and tablet
landraito.t3.2: Use Raito on your phone or tablet: it is free and easy

homeraito.t1: Do you belong to a patient organization?
homeraito.t1.1: Thanks, joining a patient organization lets you boost research by aggregating your data with the data of other patients. We will ask you later to see whether you have joined.
homeraito.t2: Thanks, please select your patient organization
homeraito.t3: Do you want to share your data with your patient group?
homeraito.p1: This is your chance to change the future of your disease. Your data will be anonymised and aggregated with other patients' to boost quality of life studies, the development of new drugs and clinical research.
homeraito.p1.1: Your data will be sent periodically to your patient organization. You can grant and revoke access at any moment with a single tap from Raito.
homeraito.p2.1: Ok, we will ask you later.
homeraito.Question: Question
homeraito.MsgDisclaimer: You are about to test GPT3, artificial intelligence system. It will answer your question automatically and there is no guarantee about the quality of the answer. Write your name if you agree and understand.
homeraito.Type a question in the text box: Type a question in the text box

charts.I want to answer how I feel today: I want to answer how I feel today
charts.There is no drug data stored: There is no drug data saved
charts.infoSeizures: Seizures are represented in total number indepentendtly of the type. If last quarter or last year is selected, then the data is the average number of seizures of the previous 7 days.
charts.infoDrugs: Drugs can be represented in percentage of the recommended drug dose or in absolute dose.
charts.infoFeel: Quality of life represents how the patient disease affects your life. The value in the graph is the average of the values you provide each time you answer the disease burden questions. The options in the questions have values from 1 to 5.
charts.If you dont keep data updated it will de: Keep your data up to date to have your container tank filled.
charts.noti1a: Welcome to Raito, your personal data container. This is your notifications area.
charts.noti2a: The level of your container is represented in the bar below. You fill it entering and sharing data.
charts.noti3a: How has the disease burden been lately?
charts.noti3b: You haven't reported about your disease burden lately. Let's do it!
charts.noti4a: Your container doesn't have seizure data. Do you want to add a seizure?
charts.noti4b: You haven't added any seizures lately. Do you have seizures to add?
charts.noti5a: Your container doesn't have drugs data. Do you want to add some?
charts.noti5b: You haven't changed your drugs lately. Do you have anything to change?
charts.noti6a: You haven't joined a patient organization. Join now!
charts.noti7a: You haven't joined a data sharing community. Join now!

seizures.How do I export the data: How do I export the data?
seizures.INFODESCONOCIDA: If you do not know that seizure is
seizures.INFOPARCIALSIMPLE: A seizure limited to a specific area and side of the brain, without loss of consciousness.
seizures.INFOPARCIALCOMPLEJA: A seizure limited to a specific area and side of the brain, with the possibility of consciousness being lost or impaired.
seizures.INFOGENERALIZADA: A seizure beginning in a specific area of the brain and then progressing into a generalized seizure. It is important to describe the beginning of these seizures to possibly identify a focal region.
seizures.INFOTONICOCLONICAS: A seizure often referred to as grand mal seizures. These seizures begin with stiffening of the extremities followed by jerking of the extremities and face.
seizures.INFOMIOCLONIAS: A seizure with rapid, brief contractions of muscles, usually occurring at the same time on both sides of the body.
seizures.INFOCLUSTERMIOCLONICA: Same as an individual Myoclonic seizure but happens repetitively fairly close together. Seizure Tracker users have the capability of recording a related event count with this seizure type selection.
seizures.INFOATONICAS: A seizure with a sudden loss of muscle tone, often resulting in a sudden collapse. These seizures are also known as drop seizures.
seizures.INFOAUSENCIAS: A seizure with a brief lapse of awareness and or staring spell.
seizures.INFOAUSENCIAATIPICA: A seizure with a brief lapse of awareness and or staring spell but can be responsive.
seizures.INFOESPASMOS: Clusters of quick, sudden movements often occurring in children between 3 months and two years but can continue through later years.
seizures.INFOESTATUS: Status epilepticus is said to occur when a seizure lasts too long or when seizures occur close together and the patient doesn't recover between seizures.
seizures.Write down any details: Write down any details that could be important
seizures.These are the symptoms included in Raito: These are the symptoms included in Raito by the user:
seizures.No symptoms have been added in Raito: No symptoms have been added in Raito.

mydata.title: My data container
mydata.desc: Your container is your own personal space to store your data and share it for your own disease management and research. Here you can manage your container.
mydata.a1: In Raito you are the only owner of your data. Your data is stored in your device and periodically backed up to your own cloud storage such as OneDrive, GoogleDrive or iCloud, depending on your preferences.
mydata.a2.1: You are currently sharing data with the data network community of DSEF.
mydata.a2.2: Follow this link for more info: https://dravet.eu/
mydata.a2.5: If you want to stop your participation, revoke access here
mydata.a2.6: You haven't joined the DSEF data network community, please join below.
mydata.In RAITO you decide for your data: In RAITO you decide for your data
mydata.Who has access to your data: Who has access to your data
mydata.When and for how long it is shared: When and for how long it is shared
mydata.Consent for editing and new input capabi: Consent for editing and new input capabilities
mydata.Use this dashboard to accept: Use this dashboard to accept, get informed or deny access to your data at anytime.
mydata.Share your data anonymously with your pa: Share your data anonymously with your patient group
mydata.You do not belong to any patient group: You do not belong to any patient group
mydata.Here is a message on why this is importa: Here is a message on why this is important
mydata.exportText: A single file with all your current data will be downloaded to your device. You can them keep this file or share it with institutions, researchers through any application you choose.
mydata.All data saved with FHIR standard: All data saved with FHIR standard
mydata.FHIR1: FHIR, pronounced 'fire', stands for Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources. It is a common language used by multiple medical information systems. As common languages do, it allows communication between them. Having your data in FHIR means that you can take it to many hospitals in the world and they will be able to read it and incorporate in your medical record.
mydata.sharepart1: You can download or share a summary report of your data. You can also download or share an anonymized copy of your data for research.
mydata.sharecontent1: The report includes seizure, quality of life and medication graphs, as well as your list of symptoms.
mydata.sharecontent2: The generated file is intended for data aggregation and analysis.
mydata.we will close your session: For your security, we will close your session.
mydata.please enter your password: For security reasons, please enter your password

prereg.title: This is how we manage data
prereg.subtitle: You need to read the complete text of the Privacy Policy for legal purposes, but we really don't like this requirement so we made a summary for you.
prereg.a1: RAITO will only know your name, last name and email. Your patient group may receive anonymous medical information to support research in your disease. You can finally participate directly with your knowledge!
prereg.a2.1: You may share your medical data anonymously with your Patient Organization by granting access to it. You can also send anonymous copies to whoever you want.
prereg.a3: Raito will store only name and contact information, while your medical data will be stored where you choose. You can store it in your device or in your cloud storage provider. Raito will help you with this. We call this folder your own data container.
prereg.a4: Nobody else has access to your data. Your data is yours and is safe.
prereg.t6: What data is shared with F29?
prereg.a6: Raito collects basic user information data. In order to provide you with Raito’s services, we collect your name and email. All the other data that you include in Raito is stored in your own device or your own cloud storage service, so F29 does not have access to it.
prereg.readPolicy: Read the full version of the Privacy Policy here

documents.medicalRecordsSubtitle: Upload here any file you want have readily available.
documents.emergencySubtitle: Upload here important files that describe how to act in case of emergencies.

termsDravet.title: Privacy policy
termsDravet.t1: Who is the one responsible for the processing of your data?
termsDravet.a1.1: In accordance with current regulations, the interested party is informed that the information provided will be processed by Dravet Syndrome European Federation (hereinafter, 'DSEF), whose contact information is as follows:
termsDravet.a1.2: Registered office: c/o Irena Bibic, Don Rafaela Radice 11, 21 251 Zrnovnica, Split, Croatia
termsDravet.t2: What data is shared with DSEF?
termsDravet.a2: Only anonymous data is shared with DSEF. In your personal data container, data that identifies you as a person is separated from medical data. This medical data is effectively anonymous and can be shared without revealing your identity. This is the data that is periodically sent to DSEF.
termsDravet.t3: How often is data shared with DSEF?
termsDravet.a3: Your personal data container is continuously synchronizing with the aggregated data container stored by DSEF. So new data will be sent once you update your container information. Depending on the situation, it can be sent right away or once a day.
termsDravet.t4: With what purpose will your anonymous data be treated and for how long?
termsDravet.a4.1: When users provide anonymous data through the connection established between their personal data container and DSEF’s data container, their anonymous data will be processed for the following purposes:
termsDravet.a4.2: Your anonymous data will be aggregated with the data from other Raito users.
termsDravet.a4.3: The aggregated data will be used for multiple research projects to identify the key traits of Dravet syndrome patients and to provide evidence about the quality of life of Dravet syndrome families.
termsDravet.t5: What is the legitimation of the treatment of data?
termsDravet.a5: Your data will be treated on the basis of your expressed enrollment into the research program.
termsDravet.t6: What rights does the interested one have?
termsDravet.a6.1: The interested party has the right to:
termsDravet.a6.3: Request the cancellation of your data when, among other reasons, the data is no longer necessary for the purposes for which it was collected.
termsDravet.a6.4: To the portability of your data.
termsDravet.a6.5: The exercise of these rights must be done through the email info@dravet.eu.
termsDravet.a7: The personal data provided will not be transferred to third parties without prior authorization by the owner of the same.
termsDravet.footer1: Notwithstanding the foregoing, the interested party may contact DSEF through info@dravet.eu
termsDravet.footer2: Likewise, when the interested party considers that the exercise of their rights has not been effective, they may file a complaint with the Croatian Agency for Data Protection.
